Package it.polimi.vovarini.model.godcards.deciders

Class ReachabilityDecider

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.vovarini.model.godcards.deciders.Decider
it.polimi.vovarini.model.godcards.deciders.ReachabilityDecider
public class ReachabilityDecider
extends Decider
ReachabilityDecider is an extension of Decider. It decides what boxes a player can move to
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ReachabilityDecider()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static boolean canExchangeWithWorker​(GameDataAccessor gameData, Point point)
    This method represents an alternative condition on reachability, allowing you to reach an adjacent box occupied by an opponent's worker
    static boolean cannotMoveUp​(GameDataAccessor gameData, Point point)
    This method represents a constraint on reachability, denying the other players to level up with a movement if the player currently playing did not level up in his turn
    static boolean conditionedExchange​(GameDataAccessor gameData, Point point)
    This method represents an alternative condition on reachability, allowing you to reach an adjacent box occupied by an opponent's worker if conditions connected to the player's GodCard are verified
    static boolean previousBoxDenied​(GameDataAccessor gameData, Point point)
    This method represents a constraint on reachability, denying you to reach your previous box if you are performing two movements in a row

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • ReachabilityDecider

      public ReachabilityDecider()

  • Method Details

    • canExchangeWithWorker

      public static boolean canExchangeWithWorker​(GameDataAccessor gameData, Point point) throws java.lang.RuntimeException
      This method represents an alternative condition on reachability, allowing you to reach an adjacent box occupied by an opponent's worker
      Parameters:
      gameData - is the gameData currently played by all the players
      point - is the destination of movement selected by the current player
      Returns:
      true if the chosen position is reachable, false if it isn't
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException

    • conditionedExchange

      public static boolean conditionedExchange​(GameDataAccessor gameData, Point point) throws java.lang.RuntimeException
      This method represents an alternative condition on reachability, allowing you to reach an adjacent box occupied by an opponent's worker if conditions connected to the player's GodCard are verified
      Parameters:
      gameData - is the gameData currently played by all the players
      point - is the destination of movement selected by the current player
      Returns:
      true if there is an opponent's worker on the point chosen as the destination and if the opponent's worker can be forced one space straight backwards to an unoccupied space at any level, false otherwise
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException

    • previousBoxDenied

      public static boolean previousBoxDenied​(GameDataAccessor gameData, Point point)
      This method represents a constraint on reachability, denying you to reach your previous box if you are performing two movements in a row
      Parameters:
      gameData - is the gameData currently played by all the players
      point - is the destination of movement selected by the current player
      Returns:
      false if the destination point is the initial point, true otherwise

    • cannotMoveUp

      public static boolean cannotMoveUp​(GameDataAccessor gameData, Point point) throws java.lang.RuntimeException
      This method represents a constraint on reachability, denying the other players to level up with a movement if the player currently playing did not level up in his turn
      Parameters:
      gameData - is the current gameData played by all the players
      point - is the destination of movement selected by the current player
      Returns:
      false if the destination point is higher than the current worker position, true otherwise
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException
